page.title: 02Armed Forces in Leverton
page.content: Our area is used as an overfly area to the range for the Royal Air Force,the United States Air Force and NATO forces and a testing ground for new aircraft and pilots. They come from local RAF bases at Coningsby,Scampton, Waddington and the USAAF base at Mildenhall in Suffolk.During NATO exercises aircraft also come from France,Belgium and West Germany.The aircraft are usually Phantoms,F-111's, Jaguars,Tornados and A-10's. Occasionally the Battle of Britain Memorial flight flies over here on its way to displays.Although the use of the range is necessary,people in the area do not appreciate the noise of the aircraft either during the day or at night.A warning is usually given in the local newspaper and on the radio if any major NATO exercise is to take place involving low-flying aircraft.
